intro: Hedyotis terminaliflora, commonly known as the redroot or redstem strobilant, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 60 cm, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, clustered in terminal inflorescences, and are usually pink or red in color. Hedyotis terminaliflora is adapted to moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade.
